Posts.Title: Xeloda as maintenance drug Bonnielv Tracy1964

Posts.Content: tracey2424 wrote: well today i finally got my Trial info through, after my last scans in January my liver mets showed progression as I had been on Herceptin only for the past 10 month. Had my last Herceptin on 3rd Feb and then had to be off all treatment for 5 wks to enter the trial.(which has been scary no treatment) The new drug in the phase 3 trial shows promise and has been used for a variety of cancer chemos with good responses, so its now being tryed for Breast. Its called Eribulin and im due to start next tuesday this is an IV in the arm on Day 1 and Day 8 then two wks offand so on. Apparently this drug is due for release early 2010. Hoping this is as easy for me as the Xelodia was. Love Tracey 2424 uk.xx  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Got my Trial Info at last... tracey2424 WendyV

Posts.Content: tracey2424 wrote: Hi Ladies, I feel the need to come and rant before trying to get through the day, recent scans show progression last Tuesday since then i am finding it so hard to lift myself, usually such an upbeat strong person but this has just knocked the wind right out my sails. Onc wants me to go on a new clinical trial to start March 10th thought that was maybe a good sign that he didnt put me staright back onto Chemo at my last visit. He has said i can either go back on Xelodia that was my last chemo (which made the liver mets shrink) and was just kept on Herceptin or start the new trial. Not much info on the trial as yet but from what i can gather its Phase 111 and is a chemo similar to Xelodia. I did really well on Xelodia with hardly any side effects so im very temted to enter the trial, its just lifting myself in the meantime as five weeeks seems an awful long time to wait im inpatient to get started. Everyone i seem to  tell that onc has suggested a new clinical trial seem to sound excited even his receptionist, should i be? If i dont get on with the trial i can always go back to Xelodia the choice is mine, whereas if i go back to Xelodia now i cant go on the trial at a later date. (treatments so far (A/C, Taxotere, Xelodia) i guess to some people im only at the beginning of my treatments.  Thanks for listening ladies feel better already what would we do without this board!!! By the way the trial is called the Esai trial E7389. Hugs Tracey. x  Tracey. x  Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: tracey2424 wrote: Hi all i posted last week due to my eyes being yellow and itchy skin, well i started my chemo Tuesday Gemzar /Cisplatin and there still as yellow am i being impatient as this is freaking me out i look awful, since having Liver mets for the last two yrs i have never had this, i know one of my enzymes was elevated and the onc reduced the dose of the Gemzar until hopefully my enzymes come back to the normal range. i feel so paranoid ..... Has anyone else experienced this the onc never commented on them when i saw him Tuesday, im currently doing Gemzar/ cisplatin wk 1 and Gemzar alone wk 2 and wk 3 off. Tracey.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: yellow eyes tracey2424 peachy49

Posts.Content: tracey2424 wrote: well here i am went for my chemo today been on Gemzar/cisplatin and onc says that as my Liver enzymes are too high and he has a gut feeling the chemos not working that i cannot go onto anymore chemo, my next one was going to be Navebline but he says i cant have it, or should i put it that i could have it but maybe go into liver failure. after speaking to another patient she had been on the same regime as me and was taken off due to scans showing it had not worked but she had all the same symptoms as me high liver tests , swelling etc. as you can imagine i came out feeling absolutley gobsmacked even more so as i feel very well in myself, so im going to go to the Royal Marsden in London for a second opinion i cannot give up yet i have two kids who i cant look in the face at the moment as my heart is breaking.  I was on Herceptin only up until christmas and had been for 11 months and just because i waited for a clinical trial to start then to be told i couldnt enter due to being on Herceptin i have just deteriorated with the Liver Tests. Tracey.  Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2007 03:40PM tracey2424 wrote: Hi Kenna Iam anotherone on this board with Mets straight on presentation i was diagnosed last May with Grade 2 and a week later after scans i was diagnosed with 2 liver mets i started on chemo and this shrunk the breast tumor straight away but not the liver so i started an oral chemo which for me was a very easy chemo and also shrunk the tumors, i finished that chemo in May and i am continuing on Herceptin i have just had latest scans after no chemo for 3 months and there still shrinking, look and feel absolutley fine and dont know what i would have done without the ladies on these boards, it really does lift your spirits when your feeling low, so take care, love Tracey.x (uk)

Posts.Title: Failed Herceptin now onto Gemzar tracey2424 macs

Posts.Content: tracey2424 wrote: Hi just been today and got my ct results showing progression in the liver, (my history) been off chemo now since last May i was on Xelodia with Herceptin, all scams showed shrinkage since then. SO my onc gave me the Heceptin today probably the last one and wants me to enter into a Phase 3 trial has starts opens on 28th February. Its the E7389 Esai (Embrace study) to enter this you have to have failed on Herceptin, or he has given me the choice of going back onto Xelodia which i tolerated very well. so its decision time hes not in any rush he said i need to have been off Treatment for 5 wks to enter the trial, and to think about it. Dont think theres any hair loss so thats a good thing. Im trying my hardest to stay upbeat today obviously im dissapointed at the Herceptin failure and really dont know what to do!!! Has anyone heard off this trial that could give me some insight into it. Love Tracey.  Log in to post a reply
